setVariants.name: Reverse Holo
setVariants.description: The reverse holo print of the set.

setVariants.name: Unlimited
setVariants.description: The unlimited print of the set.

cards.name: Articuno

abilities.name: Freezing Screech
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Articuno from your hand onto your Bench, you may flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon. That Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.text: A legendary bird Pokémon. It can create blizzards by freezing moisture in the air.

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. If tails, this attack does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Cresselia
cards.text: Shiny particles are released from its wings like a veil. It is said to represent the crescent moon.

attacks.name: Future Sight
attacks.text: Look at the top 5 cards of either player's deck and put them back on top of that player's deck in any order.

attacks.name: Healing Light
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon.

cards.name: Darkrai

abilities.name: Darkness Shade
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Darkrai from your hand onto your Bench, you may choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon. That Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.text: It can lull people to sleep and make them dream. It is active during nights of the new moon.

attacks.name: Dark Slumber
attacks.text: At the end of your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Dark Resolve
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Asleep, remove 4 damage counters from Darkrai.

cards.name: Dialga
cards.text: Adamant Orb: If an Active Pokémon has Weakness to Metal type, Dialga's attacks do 20 more damage to that Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Time Shift
attacks.text: Draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.

attacks.name: Diamond Blast
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 60 damage plus 20 more damage.

cards.name: Glaceon
cards.text: As a protective technique, it can completely freeze its fur to make its hairs stand like needles.

attacks.name: Snow Cloak
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Glaceon during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Speed Slide
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Kabutops

abilities.name: Primal Shell
abilities.text: As long as Kabutops is your Active Pokémon, your opponent can't play any Trainer cards from his or her hand.

cards.text: It is thought that this Pokémon came onto land because its prey adapted to life on land.

attacks.name: Chop Up
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Leafeon
cards.text: Just like a plant, it uses photosynthesis. As a result, it is always enveloped in clear air.

attacks.name: Bind Down
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Leaf Guard
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Leafeon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Manaphy

abilities.name: Aqua Skin
abilities.text: When you attach a Water Energy card from your hand to Manaphy, remove 2 damage counters from Manaphy.

cards.text: Born on a cold seafloor, it will swim great distances to return to its birthplace.

attacks.name: Chase Up
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for any 1 card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Fountain
attacks.text: You may attach up to 2 basic Water Energy cards from your hand to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like.

cards.name: Mewtwo
cards.text: A Pokémon created by recombining Mew's genes. It's said to have the most savage heart among Pokémon.

attacks.name: Energy Absorption
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for up to 2 Energy cards and attach them to Mewtwo.

attacks.name: Recover
attacks.text: Discard a Psychic Energy attached to Mewtwo and remove 6 damage counters from Mewtwo.

cards.name: Moltres

abilities.name: Flame Charge
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Moltres from your hand onto your Bench, you may flip a coin. If heads, search your discard pile for up to 3 Fire Energy cards and attach them to Moltres.

cards.text: One of the legendary bird Pokémon. It is said that its appearance indicates the coming of spring.

attacks.name: Scorching Wing
attacks.text: Discard all Fire Energy attached to Moltres.

cards.name: Palkia
cards.text: Lustrous Orb: If an Active Pokémon has Weakness to Water type, Palkia's attacks do 20 more damage to that Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Zone Shift
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Pearl Blast
attacks.text: You may return an Energy card attached to Palkia to your hand. If you do, choose an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon and return it to your opponent's hand.

cards.name: Phione
cards.text: A Pokémon that lives in warm seas. It inflates the flotation sac on its head to drift and search for food.

attacks.name: Evolution Wish
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from 1 of your Pokémon and put it onto that Pokémon. (This counts as evolving that Pokémon.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Water Pulse
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Rotom
cards.text: Its body is composed of plasma. It is known to infiltrate electronic devices and wreak havoc.

attacks.name: Dual Trans
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for up to 2 basic Energy cards and attach them to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Reflect Energy
attacks.text: Move an Energy card attached to Rotom to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Zapdos

abilities.name: Sheet Lightning
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you put Zapdos from your hand onto your Bench, you may flip a coin. If heads, put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon.

cards.text: A legendary Pokémon that is said to live in thunderclouds. It freely controls lightning bolts.

attacks.name: Raging Thunder
attacks.text: Does 40 damage to 1 of your Pokémon, and don't apply Weakness and Resistance to this damage.

cards.name: Aerodactyl

abilities.name: Primal Claw
abilities.text: After your opponent's Pokémon uses a Poké-Power, put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon.

cards.text: A Pokémon that roamed the skies in the dinosaur era. Its teeth are like saw blades.

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Bronzong

abilities.name: Cursed Alloy
abilities.text: As long as Bronzong is your Active Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon that has any Poké-Powers between turns.

cards.text: One caused a news sensation when it was dug up at a construction site after a 2,000-year sleep.

attacks.name: Pain Amplifier
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon that already has damage counters on it.

attacks.name: Coating
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Bronzong by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Empoleon
cards.text: It swims as fast as a jet boat. The edges of its wings are sharp and can slice apart drifting ice.

attacks.name: Dual Splash
attacks.text: Choose 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Surf Together
attacks.text: Does 50 damage plus 10 more damage for each of your Benched Pokémon. Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Espeon

abilities.name: Sunlight Veil
abilities.text: Each of your Pokémon that evolves from Eevee gets +20 HP. You can't use more than 1 Sunlight Veil Poké-Body each turn.

cards.text: Its fur has the look and feel of velvet. The orb on its forehead glows when it uses psycho-power.

attacks.name: Morning Sun
attacks.text: You may move an Energy card attached to Espeon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Flareon
cards.text: It has a flame sac in its body. Its body temperature tops 1,650 degrees Fahrenheit before battle.

attacks.name: Fire Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Kindle
attacks.text: Discard an Energy card attached to Flareon and then discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Glaceon
cards.text: As a protective technique, it can completely freeze its fur to make its hairs stand like needles.

attacks.name: Ice Shot
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Icy Wind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Hippowdon
cards.text: Its huge mouth is almost seven feet across. It has enough power to completely crush a car.

attacks.name: Vacuum Sand
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a Fighting Energy card and attach it to Hippowdon.

attacks.name: Sand Impact
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Fighting Energy attached to Hippowdon. This attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

cards.name: Infernape
cards.text: Its crown of fire is indicative of its fiery nature. It is beaten by none in terms of quickness.

attacks.name: Mach Punch
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Mega Bravo
attacks.text: Discard all Fire Energy attached to Infernape. This attack does 40 damage times the amount of Fire Energy you discarded.

cards.name: Jolteon
cards.text: It controls 10,000-volt power and can raise all the furs on its body as if it were sharp needles.

attacks.name: Thunder Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Lightning Strike
attacks.text: You may discard 2 Energy attached to Jolteon. If you do, this attack's base damage is 90 instead of 50.

cards.name: Leafeon
cards.text: Just like a plant, it uses photosynthesis. As a result, it is always enveloped in clear air.

attacks.name: Sprial Drain
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from Leafeon.

attacks.name: Leaf Blade
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 damage plus 20 more damage.

cards.name: Minun
cards.text: It cheers on friends. If its friends are losing, its body lets off more and more sparks.

attacks.name: (+) Spark
attacks.text: If Plusle is on your Bench, this attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Omastar

abilities.name: Primal Swirl
abilities.text: Once during your turn, when you play Omastar from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may remove the highest Stage Evolution card from each of your opponent's Benched Evolved Pokémon and put those cards back into his or her hand. You can't use more than 1 Primal Swirl Poké-Power each turn.

cards.text: It is thought that this Pokémon became extinct because its spiral shell grew too large.

attacks.name: Send Back
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Phione
cards.text: A Pokémon that lives in warm seas. It inflates the flotation sac on its head to drift and search for food.

attacks.name: Charm
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 20 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Whirlpool
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Plusle
cards.text: It cheers on friends with pom-poms made of sparks. It drains power from telephone poles.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: – Boost
attacks.text: If Minun is on your Bench, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

cards.name: Scizor
cards.text: It has a steel-hard body. It intimidates foes by upraising its eye-patterned pincers.

attacks.name: Special Blow
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Special Energy cards attached to it, this attack does 30 damage plus 50 more damage.

attacks.name: X-Scissor
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 damage plus 40 more damage.

cards.name: Torterra
cards.text: Groups of this Pokémon migrating in search of water have been mistaken for "moving forests."

attacks.name: Earthquake
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Frenzy Plant
attacks.text: Torterra can't use Frenzy Plant during your next turn.

cards.name: Toxicroak
cards.text: The toxin made in its poison sacs is pumped to the knuckle claws through tubes down its arms.

attacks.name: Paralyze Poison
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.

cards.name: Umbreon

abilities.name: Moonlight Veil
abilities.text: Each of your Pokémon that evolves from Eevee has no Weakness, and that Pokémon's Retreat Cost is 0.

cards.text: The light of the moon changed Eevee's genetic structure. It lurks in darkness for prey.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Unown [P]

abilities.name: PUT
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Unown P is on your Bench, you may put 1 damage counter on 1 of your Pokémon (excluding any Unown).

cards.text: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or Unown came first.

attacks.name: Hidden Power
attacks.text: Each player discards the top card of his or her deck. This attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage for each Unown discarded in this way.

cards.name: Vaporeon
cards.text: It has evolved to be suitable for aquatic life. It can invisibly melt away into water.

attacks.name: Cleanse Away
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from each of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hyper Whirlpool
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Ambipom
cards.text: To eat, it deftly shucks nuts with its two tails. It rarely uses its arms now.

attacks.name: Astonish
attacks.text: Choose 1 card from your opponent's hand without looking. Look at that card you chose, then have your opponent shuffle that card into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Hang High
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Fearow
cards.text: It has the stamina to fly all day on its broad wings. It fights by using its sharp beak.

attacks.name: Fury Attack
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Grotle
cards.text: The shell is hardened soil. Some Pokémon come to peck the berries growing on the trees on its back.

attacks.name: Planting
attacks.text: Attach a Grass Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Kangaskhan
cards.text: It raises its offspring in its belly pouch. It lets the baby out to play only when it feels safe.

attacks.name: Comet Punch
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Lickitung
cards.text: Instead of hands, it uses its tongue, which is twice its height. Its sticky saliva grips anything.

attacks.name: Lap Up
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Manectric
cards.text: It discharges electricity from its mane. It creates a thundercloud overhead to drop lightning bolts.

attacks.name: Thunder Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Volt Crush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to Manectric and this attack does 40 damage plus 30 more damage.

cards.name: Monferno
cards.text: It uses ceilings and walls to launch aerial attacks. Its fiery tail is but one weapon.

attacks.name: Fire Fang
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Mid-air Strike
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

cards.name: Mothim

abilities.name: Disturbance Scales
abilities.text: Any damage done by attacks from your Pokémon to the Defending Pokémon isn't affected by Resistance.

cards.text: It loves the honey of flowers and steals honey collected by Combee.

attacks.name: Get Help
attacks.text: Does 30 damage times the number of different types of Wormadam on your Bench.

attacks.name: Quick Touch
attacks.text: You may switch Mothim with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you do, move as many Energy cards attached to Mothim as you like to the new Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Pachirisu
cards.text: It makes electricity with pouches in its cheeks and shoots charges from its tail. It lives atop trees.

attacks.name: Trans Tail
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a Lightning Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand.

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Prinplup
cards.text: Its wings deliver wicked blows that snap even the thickest of trees. It searches for prey in icy seas.

attacks.name: Ice Blade
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Wash Over
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Raichu
cards.text: It can loose 100,000-volt bursts of electricity, instantly downing foes several times its size.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Raichu during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Thunderbolt
attacks.text: Discard all Energy cards attached to Raichu.

cards.name: Scyther
cards.text: It is nearly impossible to parry its attacking scythes. Its movements are like a ninja's.

attacks.name: Fury Cutter
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. If 1 of them is heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage. If 2 of them are heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage. If all of them are heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 40 more damage.

cards.name: Staravia
cards.text: It lives in forests and fields. Squabbles over territory occur when flocks collide.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 30 more damage.

cards.name: Sudowoodo
cards.text: It stands along paths pretending to be a tree. If it starts raining, it seems to disappear.

attacks.name: Flail
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Sudowoodo.

attacks.name: Wood Hammer
attacks.text: Sudowoodo does 30 damage to itself.

cards.name: Unown [Q]

abilities.name: QUICK
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Unown Q is on your Bench, you may discard all cards attached to Unown Q and attach Unown Q to 1 of your Pokémon as a Pokémon Tool card. As long as Unown Q is attached to a Pokémon, you pay Colorless less to retreat that Pokémon.

cards.text: Shaped like ancient writing, it is a huge mystery whether language or Unown came first.

cards.name: Aipom
cards.text: It lives atop giant trees. It wraps its tail around a branch so it won't fall off while asleep.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Hand Trick
attacks.text: Return Aipom and all cards attached to it to your hand. (If you don't have any Benched Pokémon, this attack does nothing.)

cards.name: Aipom
cards.text: It uses its tail to pluck fruits that are out of reach. Its tail is more adept than its real hands.

attacks.name: Last Resort
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Bronzor
cards.text: X-ray photos were taken to check its body structure. Nothing appeared, however.

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Buneary
cards.text: When it senses danger, it perks up its ears. On cold nights, it sleeps with its head tucked into its fur.

attacks.name: Drawup Power
attacks.text: Search your deck for an Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Extend Ears
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from each of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Burmy Sandy Cloak
cards.text: If its cloak is broken in battle, it quickly remakes the cloak with materials nearby.

attacks.name: Iron Defense
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Burmy Sandy Cloak during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Chatot
cards.text: It can learn and speak human words. If they gather, they all learn the same saying.

attacks.name: Mimic
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw a number of cards equal to the number of cards in your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Chatter
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Chimchar
cards.text: Its fiery rear end is fueled by gas made in its belly. Even rain can't extinguish the fire.

attacks.name: Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Chimchar
cards.text: Cheri Berry: If Chimchar is Paralyzed, remove the Special Condition Paralyzed from Chimchar at the end of each player's turn.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Chingling

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Chimecho from your hand onto Chingling (this counts as evolving Chingling) and remove all damage counters from Chingling.

cards.text: It emits cries by agitating an orb at the back of its throat. It moves with flouncing hops.

attacks.name: Uproar
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Combee
cards.text: It collects and delivers honey to its colony. At night, they cluster to form a beehive and sleep.

attacks.name: Honey Scent
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Flitter
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

cards.name: Croagunk
cards.text: Inflating its poison sacs, it makes an eerie blubbering sound for intimidation.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Drifloon
cards.text: It tugs on the hands of children to steal them away. However, it gets pulled around instead.

attacks.name: Delivery
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put any 1 card from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Reaction
attacks.text: Switch Drifloon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Eevee
cards.text: A rare Pokémon that adapts to harsh environments by taking on different evolutionary forms.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for as many Eevee as you like and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Eevee
cards.text: A rare Pokémon that adapts to harsh environments by taking on different evolutionary forms.

attacks.name: Sand Attack
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

cards.name: Electrike
cards.text: Using electricity stored in its fur, it stimulates its muscles to heighten its reaction speed.

attacks.name: Random Spark
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Glameow
cards.text: With its sharp glare, it puts foes in a mild hypnotic state. It is a very fickle Pokémon.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Rip Claw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Hippopotas
cards.text: It enshrouds itself with sand to protect itself from germs. It does not enjoy getting wet.

attacks.name: Grainy Sand
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Double-edge
attacks.text: Hippopotas does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Kabuto

abilities.name: Ancient Guidance
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for Helix Fossil, Dome Fossil, or Old Amber and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Kabuto is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: It is thought to have inhabited beaches 300 million years ago. It is protected by a stiff shell.

cards.name: Munchlax

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Snorlax from your hand onto Munchlax (this counts as evolving Munchlax) and remove all damage counters from Munchlax.

cards.text: It hides food under its long body hair. However, it forgets it has hidden the food.

attacks.name: Lick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Omanyte

abilities.name: Call Up
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, search your discard pile for Helix Fossil, Dome Fossil, or Old Amber and put it onto your Bench. This power can't be used if Omanyte is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: A Pokémon that was resurrected from a fossil using modern science. It swam in ancient seas.

attacks.name: Wash Over
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Pikachu
cards.text: If it looses crackling power from the electric pouches on its cheeks, it is being wary.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Volt Tackle
attacks.text: Pikachu does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Piplup
cards.text: It lives along shores in northern countries. A skilled swimmer, it dives for over 10 minutes to hunt.

attacks.name: Water Splash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

cards.name: Piplup
cards.text: Pecha Berry: If Piplup is Poisoned, remove the Special Condition Poisoned from Piplup at the end of each player's turn.

attacks.name: Splatter
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

cards.name: Shellos East Sea
cards.text: It lives along bodies of water. Its body shape changed to suit its habitat.

attacks.name: Muddy Water
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Spearow
cards.text: It flaps its small wings busily to fly. Using its beak, it searches in grass for prey.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Starly
cards.text: Usually with a large flock, it is barely noticeable when alone. Its cries are very strident.

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Stunky
cards.text: It sprays a nose-curling, stinky fluid from its rear to repel attackers.

attacks.name: Poison Gas
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Turtwig
cards.text: It undertakes photosynthesis with its body, making oxygen. The leaf on its head wilts if it is thirsty.

cards.name: Turtwig
cards.text: Persim Berry: If Turtwig is Confused, remove the Special Condition Confused from Turtwig at the end of each player's turn.

cards.name: Dawn Stadium
cards.text: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.,Whenever any player attaches an Energy card from his or her hand to Grass Pokémon or Water Pokémon, remove 1 damage counter and all Special Conditions from that Pokémon.

cards.name: Dusk Ball
cards.text: Look at the 7 cards from the bottom of your deck. Choose 1 Pokémon you find there, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Put the remaining cards back on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Energy Restore
cards.text: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, put a Basic Energy card from your discard pile into your hand. If you don't have that many basic Energy cards in your discard pile, put all of them into your hand.

cards.name: Fossil Excavator
cards.text: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.,Search your deck or discard pile for a Trainer card that has Fossil in its name or a Stage 1 or Stage 2 Evolution card that evolves from a Fossil. Show it to your opponent and put it into your hand. If you searched your deck, shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Mom's Kindness
cards.text: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.,Draw 2 cards.

cards.name: Old Amber

abilities.name: Hard Amber
abilities.text: As long as Old Amber is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to Old Amber by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

cards.text: Play Old Amber as if it were a Colorless Basic Pokémon. (Old Amber counts as a Trainer card as well, but if Old Amber is Knocked Out, this counts as a Knocked Out Pokémon.) Old Amber can't be affected by any Special Conditions and can't retreat. At any time during your turn before your attack, you may discard Old Amber from play. (This doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokémon.)

cards.name: Poké Ball
cards.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Pokémon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Quick Ball
cards.text: Reveal cards from your deck until you reveal a Pokémon. Show that Pokémon to your opponent and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other revealed cards back into your deck. (If you don't reveal a Pokémon, shuffle all the revealed cards back into your deck.)

cards.name: Super Scoop Up
cards.text: Flip a coin. If heads, return 1 of your Pokémon and all cards attached to it to your hand.

cards.name: Warp Point
cards.text: Your opponent switches 1 of his or her Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon, if any. You switch 1 of your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon, if any.

cards.name: Dome Fossil

abilities.name: Rock Reaction
abilities.text: When you attach a Fighting Energy card from your hand to Dome Fossil (excluding effects of attacks or Poké-Powers), search your deck for a card that evolves from Dome Fossil and put it onto Dome Fossil (this counts as evolving Dome Fossil). Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.text: Play Dome Fossil as if it were a Colorless Basic Pokémon. (Dome Fossil counts as a Trainer card as well, but if Dome Fossil is Knocked Out, this counts as a Knocked Out Pokémon.) Dome Fossil can't be affected by any Special Conditions and can't retreat. At any time during your turn before your attack, you may discard Dome Fossil from play. (This doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokémon.)

cards.name: Energy Search
cards.text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Helix Fossil

abilities.name: Aqua Reaction
abilities.text: When you attach a Water Energy card from your hand to Helix Fossil (excluding effects of attacks or Poké-Powers), search your deck for a card that evolves from Helix Fossil and put it onto Helix Fossil (this counts as evolving Helix Fossil). Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.text: Play Helix Fossil as if it were a Colorless Basic Pokémon. (Helix Fossil counts as a Trainer card as well, but if Helix Fossil is Knocked Out, this counts as a Knocked Out Pokémon.) Helix Fossil can't be affected by any Special Conditions and can't retreat. At any time during your turn before your attack, you may discard Helix Fossil from play. (This doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokémon.)

cards.name: Call Energy
cards.text: Call Energy provides Colorless Energy. Once during your turn, if the Pokémon Call Energy is attached to is your Active Pokémon, you may search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. If you do, shuffle your deck and your turn ends.

cards.name: Darkness Energy
cards.text: If the Pokémon Darkness Energy is attached to attacks, the attack does 10 more damage to the Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance). Ignore this effect if the Pokémon that Darkness Energy is attached to isn't Darkness. Darkness Energy provides Darkness Energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

cards.name: Health Energy
cards.text: Health Energy provides Colorless Energy. When you attach this card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon, remove 1 damage counter from that Pokémon.

cards.name: Metal Energy
cards.text: Damage done by attacks to the Pokémon that Metal Energy is attached to is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). Ignore this effect if the Pokémon that Metal Energy is attached to isn't Metal. Metal Energy provides Metal Energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

cards.name: Recover Energy
cards.text: Recover Energy provides Colorless Energy. When you attach this card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon, remove all Special Conditions from that Pokémon.

cards.name: Garchomp LV.X

abilities.name: Dragon Pulse
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), when you put Garchomp LV.X from your hand onto your Active Garchomp, you may flip 3 coins. For each heads, put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

cards.text: Put this card onto your Active Garchomp. Garchomp LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

attacks.name: Restore
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a Pokémon (excluding Pokémon LV.X) and put it onto your Bench as a Basic Pokémon. Then, you may search your discard pile for up to 3 basic Energy cards and attach them to that Pokémon.

cards.name: Glaceon LV.X

abilities.name: Chilly Breath
abilities.text: As long as Glaceon is your Active Pokémon, your opponent's Pokémon can't use any Poké-Powers.

cards.text: Put this card onto your Active Glaceon. Glaceon LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

attacks.name: Avalanche
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Leafeon LV.X

abilities.name: Energy Forcing
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach an Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon. This power can't be used if Leafeon is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: Put this card onto your Active Leafeon. Leafeon LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.

attacks.name: Verdant Dance
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

cards.name: Porygon-Z LV.X

abilities.name: Mode Crash
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), when you put Porygon-Z LV.X from your hand onto your Active Porygon-Z, you may discard all of your opponent's Special Energy cards in play.

abilities.name: Decode
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for up to any 2 cards and shuffle your deck afterward. Then, put those cards on top of your deck in any order. This power can't be used if Porygon-Z is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.text: Put this card onto your Active Porygon-Z. Porygon-Z LV.X can use any attack, Poké-Power, or Poké-Body from its previous level.
